intro: Baeckea tenuiramea, commonly known as the narrow-leaf baeckea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalypts and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is found in coastal and heathland environments.
